alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 5:35PM MDT until June 29 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Natrona. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Small streams on the northwest face of Casper Mountain are running high with minor flooding currently occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 PM MDT, emergency management reported small stream and nearby flooding of low spots and creeks in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. In particular, locations near Hwy 220 along Matheson Creek are flooded, with water on Goose Egg Rd. Webb Draw valleys are also flowing with water. Small stream flooding will continue over the coming hours. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Light rain will continue over the coming hour, but heavier rain is not currently shown on radar, and is unlikely in the next hour. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Matheson Creek, Webb Draw, Soda Lake Draw, Wolf Creek, Poison Spider Creek, Sixmile Draw, Casper Creek, Iron Creek, North Platte River and Garden Creek. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Southwestern Casper, Mills, Red Butte, Paradise Valley, Emigrant Gap, Fort Caspar Campground, Casper-Natrona County International Airport, Central Wyoming Fairgrounds and Casper Mountain.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service.
